tool.name: UniProtXML Download
tool.command: python '$__tool_directory__/uniprotxml_downloader.py' -v #if $taxid.choice == 'common': --taxon '$taxid.organism' #if $taxid.reviewed: --reviewed=$taxid.reviewed #end if #else: #for id in $taxid.taxons.split(','): -t $id #end for #end if --output="${proteome}"

param.name: reviewed
param.label: filter by reviewed status
param.help: UniProtKB/TrEMBL (unreviewed)is a large, automatically annotated database that may contain redundant sequences, but there is a higher chance peptides will be identified. UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot (reviewed) is a smaller, manually annotated database with less of a chance peptides will be identified but less sequence redundancy

param.name: taxons
param.label: NCBI taxon IDs
param.help: Enter one or more Organsim IDs (separated by commas) from http://www.uniprot.org/proteomes/

tool.help:
**UniProtXML Downloader**
Downloads a UniProtXML file from UniProtKB
The Morpheus proteomics search algorithm can use this format as a search database.
Available proteomes: http://www.uniprot.org/proteomes/
UniProtKB help: http://www.uniprot.org/help/uniprotkb
